attributes.action: ensure that MPs leaving the Commons are not given more public money
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The BBC reports that MPs leaving the Commons at the next election will be eligible for a "resettlement grant" of up to £64,766, even if they are resigning due to controversy over expenses claims.

We ask the Prime Minister to ensure that MPs who are stepping down over expenses claims do not accept these grants (or donate the money to a good cause) as a gesture of good will to the tax-paying public.

The Baker Review (2008) has already recommended that resettlement grants should not be paid to MPs who retire or resign.

BBC report: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/programmes/newsnight/8081649.stm

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
